places.title: Fish Market (Mercado do Peixe)
places.address: Av. Oscar Pontes, 1 - Monte Serrat, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: A bustling hub of seafood trade, the Fish Market is where local fishermen and vendors offer fresh catches daily. Located by the waterfront, it's essential for the city's gastronomy, supplying restaurants and homes with a diverse selection of fish and seafood.

places.title: Vila Caramuru
places.description: Once a historic fish market, Vila Caramuru has transformed into a lively gastronomic and cultural center with popular seafood restaurants, live music, and vibrant nightlife, attracting both locals and tourists.

places.title: Barra Lighthouse (Farol da Barra)
places.alt: Barra Lighthouse by the sea in Salvador
places.address: Largo do Farol da Barra, s/n - Barra, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: Standing at the entrance of All Saints Bay, the Barra Lighthouse is a historic landmark offering stunning ocean views and housing the Nautical Museum of Bahia. It is a favorite spot for sunset watchers and an important cultural attraction in Salvador.

places.title: São Joaquim Fair (Feira de São Joaquim)
places.address: Feira de São Joaquim, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: A massive open-air market offering everything from fresh produce to handmade crafts, São Joaquim Fair is a key marketplace where vendors sell spices, fruits, meats, and traditional Bahian products, maintaining the city's rich cultural identity.

places.title: Bonfim Church (Igreja do Bonfim)
places.address: Largo do Bonfim, s/n - Bonfim, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: A symbol of faith and tradition, Bonfim Church is famous for its religious celebrations and the iconic Bonfim ribbons. It attracts thousands of pilgrims annually, contributing to Salvador’s spiritual and cultural tourism.

places.title: Modelo Market (Mercado Modelo)
places.address: Praça Visc. de Cayru, 250 - Comércio, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: One of Salvador’s most famous handicraft markets, Mercado Modelo is a lively spot where visitors can find authentic Bahian souvenirs, local artworks, and traditional food while enjoying views of All Saints Bay.

places.title: Lacerda Elevator (Elevador Lacerda)
places.alt: Lacerda Elevator connecting upper and lower Salvador
places.address: Praça Tomé de Souza, s/n - Comércio, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: Connecting Salvador’s upper and lower city, the Lacerda Elevator is a historical structure and a key transportation link. It provides stunning views of the bay and serves as a major landmark for tourists and locals alike.

places.title: Ribeira
places.description: Known for its scenic bay views and famous ice cream shop, Ribeira is a historic neighborhood with strong commercial activity, hosting a variety of restaurants, bars, and cultural events that enrich Salvador’s tourism and economy.

places.title: CEASA Rio Vermelho
places.alt: CEASA wholesale market in Rio Vermelho
places.address: Av. Adhemar de Barros, 2001 - Rio Vermelho, Salvador - BA, Brazil
places.description: A major wholesale market, CEASA Rio Vermelho plays a crucial role in Salvador’s food supply chain, providing fresh produce to restaurants, supermarkets, and street vendors across the city.
